>QUOTE FROM 0SKYDiVE

>hello, i am the author of a new site that is like champion.gg - counterplay.xyz. i will explain what i know about riot's api and dig into my database to see what's going on.
riot's api gives each player in a game two independent attributes that explain where they went and what they did. role and lane. lane is easy, it's: top, middle, bottom, or jungle. role can be: solo, none, duo carry, duo support, or just duo.
here's how these two attributes align to what actual players call them.
human name = api role, api lane
top = solo top
mid = solo middle
jungle = none jungle
adc = duo_carry bottom
support = duo_support bottom
of course, the api can send more combinations. my site only looks for these 5, and i'm guessing that champion.gg does the same as well.
to see what's going on, let me do a DB query to see what all of the different combos are for morde in plat:
http://i.imgur.com/1vK1PTv.png
that's interesting - there are 707 games as duo_carry bottom, but another 362 games as just 'duo bottom' (which don't count as either adc or support on my site, and probably not others as well).
by the way, if you're wondering why my sample size is so low: i scan NA games only. i'm fairly certain i have most, if not all, of the ranked games on this patch scanned.
let's check out the winrates for these different combos:
5.17 platinum morde in "duo carry, bottom" role + lane = 64.2% winrate.
5.17 platinum morde in "duo, bottom" role + lane = 51.3% winrate.
5.17 platinum morde in "duo support, bottom" role + lane = 48.9% winrate.
http://i.imgur.com/HKJqzus.png
i know lots of ADC mordes buy a relic shield to start out with. maybe that's confusing the algorithm? let's do some aggregation:
5.17 platinum morde in "bottom lane", but with any role = 59.1% winrate. still pretty strong!
http://i.imgur.com/tE338sz.png
hope this helps.
